children.subject: Thanks, but I have pretty much all the “easier” CS courses finished already, with a few exceptions that aren’t offered often. Anything project-heavy (162, 184, etc) I’m avoiding since I have my hands full at the job. Since I’m not betting on 168 being available, I’m looking into other alternatives.

Does it have to be a technical elective? Looks like you already have completed many of the easy CS upper div. You can take a look at the LS Change Maker series for some seminar courses that are online to pad units. For technical, lower division stats course may have some online sections, DATA 8 introduced a no lab attendance option recently.

Another option for you is to take courses during the summer and graduate early. There are way more online courses, especially technical like math and astrophysics, during the summer if you just need more units.

I have a course (Ling100 or some other tech elective) lined up for summer, then in the Fall I have exactly one 4-unit EE/CS course (preferably W186 or 168) and one more 4-unit upper div tech elective to meet my remaining graduation requirements. I would rather not take 2 CS classes (even easy ones) if I can help it. There’s a pretty long list of non-EECS electives so I was wondering if anyone knows if any of those classes have the QoL I’m looking for.

The list for reference: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/tech-electives

Most CS classes recorded lecture and don’t require discussion attendance if they are offered: 161, 170, 182, 188, 189, 184, 186, … I wouldn’t take an ECON class just because it’s online. There are plenty easy online courses if you just want units.

history.content:
Due to COVID weirdness I am now working full-time, but have a couple of classes left to complete. I know the Fall course list hasn’t been released yet, but are there commonly offered non-EE/CS technical electives that can be done mostly online (preferably asynchronous) that I could be looking into? I don’t mind going to campus for exams, but non-webcast lectures or mandatory discussions would likely not fit in my schedule. Of course, chill courses are preferred too. From my limited research Econ 100A/B seem to fit the bill – could anyone confirm/have other suggestions?

Edit- here are my list of options:
https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/tech-electives

Thanks!
history.subject: Remote Technical Electives Fall ‘22
